page.title: 06TOPSHAM QUAY
page.content:
On Topsham Quay there is a boatyard owned and run by the Trout family who have lived in Topsham for many years. Mr. Trout makes wooden boats in the traditional way and he also makes small wooden models of the boats he has made. The latest boat to be made was a sailing dinghy which was lifted into the water with the help of a crane. A little way along the quay you can find Mr. Pym with his ferry. It is a small motor boat which takes people across the river, mainly for fishing.
Another feature of the quayside is the Topsham Mud, a stretch of soft slimy mud which is used for playing 'mud football' during the Topsham Town Fayre celebrations. This is a very messy but popular game.
